full_text:
Popups

Lesson
objectives

* Describe the functionality of Popups
* Create Popups used to view and edit objects

User Story: Policy Details Popup Gi

“Currently, users can add, remove, and edit policy details in the Policy list view
panel. However, the editable list view panel only exposes some of the Policy
entity fields. Earlier we requested the addition of the invoicing method field only,
but we anticipate the need to add 5-10 more policy fields in the near future.
Could you analyze the different implementation options and let us know the best
way to implement this?”

— Insurance company business analysts

i Review: Locations
J wicgot a7
—'—_,

¢ Alocation is a PCF element to which a user can
navigate

* Locations themselves do not define any visual

content, but they can contain Screen container(s)
that do

¢ Locations can use system permissions to control
what the users can see/access in the application

i Review: Popups Gi

¢« Apopup contains a single screen and returns the user to the previous pef
location once the popup is closed —lE|

« Automatically has "Return to <previous location>" link

Resolution rr

i Why not use browser popup windows?

« Many users configure their web browsers to block popups
* Even if website or URL is from trusted source

¢ Passing context and objects between browser windows can cause
synchronization problems

¢ Multiple popups open for same view

* Popup window is left open while parent (main) window is closed
* Guidewire popups

* Provide almost all the functionality of true popup windows

« Avoid blocking issues and synchronization problems

i Popup use case 1: View and edit existing objects Gi
